alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Lamb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 12:25AM CDT until May 24 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern Bailey County and northern Lamb County. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1224 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated continuing heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area as additional thunderstorms move into the area. This will result in the continuation of minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Muleshoe, Earth, Sudan, Amherst, Needmore, Progress, West Camp and Springlake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
